title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 36): Copwatch and Community Defense as Power With - A Guide to Collective Safety
summary: A guide to building nonviolent community defense projects that center horizontal coordination and collective safety rather than hierarchical force.

Community.summary: Build networks of mutual protection and community safety that challenge state violence through collective action.

level0: Build trust within a small circle of people committed to community safety
Learn basic copwatch techniques and de-escalation skills
Practice safe documentation and bystander intervention in low-risk situations
level1: Form a community defense collective with clear agreements and rotating roles
Map local threats and existing community safety assets
Establish communication protocols and safety practices for collective action
level2: Organize regular copwatch activities and community safety trainings
Provide jail support and accompaniment for community members
Build relationships with other community defense and abolition groups
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous community defense collectives
Create lasting infrastructure for community-controlled safety and protection
Advocate for policies that reduce police presence and increase community resources

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share knowledge about community defense, de-escalation, and alternatives to carceral safety systems.

level0: Learn about community defense principles and nonviolent intervention techniques
Study successful examples like WeCopwatch and community safety projects
level1: Practice de-escalation, documentation, and trauma-informed safety responses
Learn legal rights and responsibilities for community defense activities
Develop skills in collective decision-making under pressure
level2: Host workshops on copwatch techniques and community safety organizing
Create resources about alternatives to police-based safety systems
Share knowledge with other community defense and abolition organizers
level3: Develop comprehensive community defense organizing toolkits
Research and document impacts of community-controlled vs state safety systems
Train facilitators and organizers in other communities

Power.summary: Challenge state violence and build community power through collective defense and mutual protection.

level0: Practice community accountability and transformative justice principles
Challenge reliance on police and carceral systems for safety
Build analysis of how community defense relates to broader liberation struggles
level1: Organize community members to collectively respond to threats and violence
Practice nonviolent confrontation of harmful systems and actors
Build collective capacity to protect vulnerable community members
level2: Coordinate community defense activities with other social justice organizing
Challenge policy and systems that rely on state violence for social control
Build political power through grassroots organizing and collective action
level3: Contribute to broader movements for abolition and transformative justice
Advocate for systemic changes that address root causes of violence and harm
Build lasting infrastructure for community self-determination and protection
